body: `restart`, `reload` etc. doesn't seem to reload any properties within the config .json file. You have to `pm2 delete <process>` first and restart it. It's quite annoying.
For me, do restart with config file like `pm2 restart conf.json` reloads all env variables. Reload I didn't test. But startOrRestart not works.

issue.title: Next release

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
- [x] Worker system for CRON restart and MAX-MEMORY-USED [#742][#697]
- [x] Append date to pm2.log [#764]
- [x] gracefulStop/gracefulRestart CLI methods [#478]
- [ ] Multiple calls to resurrect shouldn't start the processes again [#300]
- [x] Reload should update environment variable as restart do (CLI.js l979)
- [x] Delay option between restart [#498]
- [x] `--combine-logs` to merge stderr and stdout [#807]
- [x] Double check PID deletion on process exit [#797]
- [x] startOrRestart / startOrReload fixes [#805][#724][#695][[#678]
- [x] Double check `max_restarts` option [#718]
- [x] CRON restart in Worker [#662]
- [x] Action on multiple processes - (e.g.) pm2 delete 1 2 3 4
- [x] Custom path for dump files pm2 save . ; pm2 resurrect .
- [x] Smart restart (pm2 start <app_name_already_started> == pm2 restart)
- [x] Alias pm2 info by pm2 show

Follow new features and bug fix: https://github.com/Unitech/PM2/blob/development/doc/CHANGELOG.md#0122

issue.title: Revisions for dev branch

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
- Reload `env` graceful and peaceful
- Unify `appConf` - rename `ignoreWatch` to `ignore_watch`
- Documents of Schema
- CLI `ignore_watch` supports
- Validate Commander options and JSON key-values
- Divide String to Array more intelligence (ESC supports)
  
  ```
  $pm2 start test.js --node-args "port=3001 sitename='first pm2 app'"
  ```
  
  The `nodeArgs` will be
  
  ``` JSON
  [
    "port=3001",
    "sitename=first pm2 app"
  ]
  ```
  
  But not
  
  ``` JSON
  [
    "port=3001",
    "sitename='first",
    "pm2",
    "app'"
  ]
  ```
- Make options briefness and easy configuration
  - min_uptime
    
    Value of `min_uptime` could be:
    - **Number**
      e.g. `"min_uptime": 3000` means 3000 milliseconds.
    - **String**
      In the meantime we are making it briefness and easy configuration: `h`, `m` and `s`, e.g.: `"min_uptime": "1h"` means one hour, `"min_uptime": "5m"` means five minutes and `"min_uptime": "10s"` means ten seconds (At last, it will be transformed into milliseconds).
  - max_memory_restart
    
    Value of `max_memory_restart` could be:
    - **Number**
      e.g. `"max_memory_restart": 1024` means 1024 bytes (**NOT BITS**).
    - **String**
      In the meantime we are making it briefness and easy configuration: `G`, `M` and `K`, e.g.: `"max_memory_restart": "1G"` means one gigabytes, `"max_memory_restart": "5M"` means five megabytes and `"max_memory_restart": "10K"` means ten kilobytes (At last, it will be transformed into byte(s)).
- Refactor start/restart/reload (CLI, JSON), auto inspect configurations by configured schema, more output information, more humanity.
